newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African stock market closing report.
newsitem.headline: S.African stock market closing report.

text.p: South African gold shares were the market's flavour of the day on Friday, closing firmer on the back of a better bullion price.
The gold index jumped 3.2 percent, or 46.9 points, to end at 1,517.8, helping to push the all-share index 21.5 points up to 7,124.1.
"Golds were very firm on the bullion price which is still going strong," one dealer said.
"The gold index would have been higher but being a Friday, people were taking a cautious view as they rounded off their positions for the weekend," another one said.
Dealers said they expected the metals and gold sectors to continue strong on Monday if the price of the yellow metal holds at current levels.
Gold fixed at $350.75, its highest fixing since January 29, compared with $345.00 on Thursday afternoon.
"If the gold price holds, the market will take heart from that and we will see a strong market again," he said.
The Johannesburg Stock Exchange later announced that its overall share index reached a new record closing high of 7,124 on Friday. The previous high was 7,108 on Wednesday.
Dealers said despite industrials' weak drift on the day, overall market sentiment remained upbeat on positive economic fundamentals.
"Industrials were drifting off on weaker Dow Jones and also there was some profit-taking," a dealer said in reference to DOW industrials'93-point drop on Thursday.
The industrial index shed 12.4 points to end at 8,379.3.
"If Dow goes firmer industrials will go up on Monday," a dealer said.
Randgold was up 75 cents to 39.75, Rusplats rose 1.75 rand to 76.75 rand.
On the futures market, the all-share March contract was at 6,545/63 from 6,529, the industrial contract was at 8,177/85 from 8,173 and golds contract was at 1,085/95 from 1,043.
